Breadth-First.Explanation: Initial broad observation and listing of general architectural and cultural clues.
Further broad listing of architectural elements without a narrowed hypothesis.
Continued broad listing of man-made urban features for general context.
Additional broad listing of cultural clues to characterize the setting.
Still listing detailed architectural features without target hypothesis.
Generation of multiple regional hypotheses (Germany/Austria/Switzerland) based on broad clues.

Depth-First.Explanation: Focuses on a specific distinctive building and monument to narrow down the candidate set.
Depth-First.KeyElement: Distinctive white building with clock tower and painted tree decoration

Depth-First.Explanation: Convergent reasoning to a precise location hypothesis using the previously identified key elements.

Breadth-Depth Switch.Explanation: Shifts from broad regional hypothesis generation to focused verification using a specific architectural clue.
